Detailed Description

The section has a list of all the exported API which the applications need to invoke in order to use the driver.

Function Documentation

int32_t Pinmux_Get_FuncSel ( uint32_t  pin)

Get the pin functionality.

This function gets the configured functionality of the pin.

Parameters
[in]pinPin number to be configured
Returns
Value < 0 - in case of error Value > 0 - value read from the Func_Sel bits of a given valid pin
int32_t Pinmux_Get_OverrideCtrl ( uint32_t  pin,
Pinmux_Output_Override_e *  outputCtrl,
Pinmux_Input_Override_e *  inputCtrl 
)

Get the pin override control for input and output.

This function gets the configured override of the pin.

Parameters
[in]pinPin number to be queried
[out]outputCtrlvalue read from the OE_OVERRIDE and OE_OVERRIDE_CTRL bits of a given valid pin (Pinmux_Output_Override_e)
[out]inputCtrlvalue read from the IE_OVERRIDE and IE_OVERRIDE_CTRL bits of a given valid pin (Pinmux_Input_Override_e)
Returns
Value < 0 - in case of error; outputCtrl and inputCtrl have invalid values Value = 0 - success; outputCtrl and inputCtrl have valid values
int32_t Pinmux_Get_Pull ( uint32_t  pin)

Get the pin pull up/down setting.

This function gets the configured Pull up/down of the pin.

Parameters
[in]pinPin number to be queried
Returns
Value < 0 - in case of error Value > 0 - value read from the Pi and pupdsel bits of a given valid pin (Pinmux_Pull_e)
int32_t Pinmux_Get_SlewRate ( uint32_t  pin)

Get the pin slew rate.

This function gets the configured functionality of the pin.

Parameters
[in]pinPin number to be queried
Returns
Value < 0 - in case of error Value > 0 - value read from the SC1 bits of a given valid pin (Pinmux_SlewRate_e)
int32_t Pinmux_Set_FuncSel ( uint32_t  pin,
uint32_t  func 
)

Setup the pin functionality.

This function sets up the functional personality of the pin. The specified signal will be brought out on the pin. As there is no strict check on the parameters passed, the values passed must be from the macro specified in the header pinmux.h.

Parameters
[in]pinPin number to be configured
[in]funcDesired signal functionality to be muxed onto the pin
int32_t Pinmux_Set_OverrideCtrl ( uint32_t  pin,
Pinmux_Output_Override_e  outputCtrl,
Pinmux_Input_Override_e  inputCtrl 
)

Configurations for the input and output override control.

Parameters
[in]pinPin number to be configured
[in]outputCtrlOutput control selection The parameter outputCtrl can be one of the following values:
  • PINMUX_OUTPUT_EN
  • PINMUX_OUTPUT_DIS
  • PINMUX_OUTEN_RETAIN_HW_CTRL
[in]inputCtrlInput control selection The parameter inputCtrl can be one of the following values:
  • PINMUX_INPUT_EN
  • PINMUX_INPUT_DIS
  • PINMUX_INPEN_RETAIN_HW_CTRL
Returns
Value < 0 - in case of error Value = 0 - success
int32_t Pinmux_Set_Pull ( uint32_t  pin,
Pinmux_Pull_e  pullVal 
)

Configurations for the pulls on the pins.

Parameters
[in]pinPin number to be configured
[in]pullValPull selection The parameter pullVal can be one of the following values:
  • PINMUX_PULLUP_EN
  • PINMUX_PULLDOWN_EN
  • PINMUX_DISABLE_PULLS
Returns
Value < 0 - in case of error Value = 0 - success
int32_t Pinmux_Set_SlewRate ( uint32_t  pin,
Pinmux_SlewRate_e  slewVal 
)

Configurations for the slew on the pins.

Parameters
[in]pinPin number to be configured
[in]slewValSlew selection The parameter slewVal can be one of the following values:
  • PINMUX_SLEW_LOW
  • PINMUX_SLEW_HIGH
Returns
Value < 0 - in case of error Value = 0 - success
